etymologies: early 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek rhodon ‘rose’ (from the color of the solution of its salts)

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 45, a hard silvery-white metal of the transition series, typically occurring in association with platinum.

notes.text: Rhodium is chiefly used in alloys with platinum, where it increases hardness. The pure metal is used in electroplating for decorative purposes and to form reflecting surfaces
